Azure Data Engineer - HelsinkiDo you want to work within a strong internal culture that gives you limitless opportunities to grow as a professional and realize your own potential?Our client is an innovative group of experts who offer you the opportunity to complete challenging and interesting assignments utilising the latest Azure technology with colleagues who are amongst the top in the industry.Our client focuses solely on Azure Data Warehousing/Analytics, as well as Azure Integrations, working on fascinating large projects in the private sector. Employees are always working in teams in an open and friendly environment that offers flexible working options.Responsibilities: Work Full-stack with Azure technologies such as Power BI and Azure Data Factory. Design, implement and improve the client's data analytics solutions for their customers. You are involved in the whole process of projects from the design stage to the implementation stage. You work as part of a team building modern data platforms and data pipes in Microsoft Azure cloud environments.What they are looking for: You have a few years of experience in data warehousing (e.g. ETL) or integrations, and especially in Microsoft SQL Server databases. In addition to technical skills, the clients expects you to have experience in teamwork in the customer interface and the ability to promote development work independently. They value the experience of Azure, Microsoft on-premises analytics solutions and Master Data Management, The desire to learn and develop into a top-class Azure expert. Fluency in Finnish & EnglishWhat they offer: Excellent salary & benefits package They have built a quality senior team, sourcing only the best talent across Finland to ensure a high quality output Always work in project teams, no fire fighting Completely Azure based projects in the private sector Outsourced boring maintenance work to ensure colleagues work on only the most interesting and effective tasksSalary: 4500-8000EUR for the right candidateWhilst this position offers remote working all candidates must be located inside Finland with a valid work Visa.All interviews will be carried out remotely.

Haemme uutta Azure Data Engineeriä tehostamaan nykyisten ja tulevien asiakkaidemme liiketoimintaa. Data Engineerimme työskentelevät monella eri toimialalla toimivien organisaatioiden parissa. Yhteistä kaikille asiakkaille on kuitenkin me ja se apu mitä tarjoamme. Sinun tiedoillasi ja taidoillasi on suuri merkitys projektien onnistumisessa ja asiakkaiden haasteiden ratkaisemisessa. Tule siis mukaan tekemään työtä, jolla on merkitystä.Data Engineerinä käännät asiakkaidemme liiketoimintatarpeet teknisiksi ratkaisuiksi, joita pääset myös itse toteuttamaan. Suunnittelet ja rakennat asiakkaillemme Azure-pohjaisia integraatio- ja tietovarastoratkaisuja, joissa hyödynnät osaamistasi esimerkiksi Data Vault -mallinnusmenetelmästä. Oman osaamisesi mukaan voit olla mukana tekemässä hands-on konfiguraatioita, asennuksia ja skriptauksia sekä suunnittelemassa arkkitehtuureja. Lisäksi, halusi ja kykyjesi mukaan voit myös osallistua myyntiin ja olla mukana suunnittelemassa tarjoamaamme.MeistäNykyinen Data Platform-tiimimme koostuu yrittäjähenkisistä ammattilaisista jotka arvostavat asiantuntijuuttaan sekä kehittävät jatkuvasti osaamistaan. Innofactorilla annamme tiimeille vapautta sekä vastuuta ja esihenkilöidemme tehtävänä on tukea ja auttaa tiimiä menestymään, eikä sanella miten töitä pitäisi tehdä. Matalan hierarkian organisaationa työntekijöillämme on lukuisia mahdollisuuksia vaikuttaa ja kehittää omaa sekä yhteistä toimintaa.Tarjoamme sinulle:työyhteisön, jossa sinulla on mahdollisuus kehittyä yhdessä mahtavien asiakkaidemme ja osaavien kollegoiden kanssamahdollisuuden syventyä Microsoft-teknologioihin kouluttautumisen ja sertifiointien avullamielenkiintoisia ja haastavia projekteja Microsoftin uusimmilla teknologioilla ja vaihtelevilla projektihallintamenetelmilläkilpailukykyisen palkitsemisjärjestelmänjoustavat työaikajärjestelyt sekä monipuoliset, työnantajan tukemat harrastusmahdollisuudet ja yhteiset tapahtumatmukavia työtovereita ja vauhdikkaan ilmapiirin, jossa työtä tehdään tiiviisti yhdessä pilke silmäkulmassa, rautaisella ammattitaidollaSinustaOdotamme sinulta aiempaa kokemusta ja osaamista asiakkaiden liiketoimintahaasteiden ratkaisemisesta erilaisten teknisten ratkaisujen (Data Vault, Data Lake) ja työkalujen (SQL, T-SQL, SQL Server Management Studio, Azure Databricks, Azure Data Factory, WhereScape, DBT, Snowflake) avulla. Meillä pärjäävät parhaiten uteliaat ja itsensä kehittämisestä kiinnostuneet, hyvät vuorovaikutustaidot omaavat. Kommunikointi sujuvasti suomeksi ja englanniksi sekä konsultatiivinen ote auttavat sinua menestymään tehtävässä. Luemme eduksi aiemmin suoritetut Azure sertifikaatit, sekä Snowflake-osaamisesta sekä osaamisen tai ymmärryksen tietovarastojen optimoimisesta.Konsulttina meillä pystyt itse vaikuttamaan rooliisi ja tehtäviisi. Tiiminä pyrimme auttamaan sinua tunnistamaan ja hyödyntämään omia vahvuuksiasi ja mielenkiinnon kohteitasi projekteja suunnitellessamme. Apunasi ja tukenasi työskentelee siis liuta konsultteja sekä aktiivinen myyntiorganisaatiomme. Saat kokonaisvaltaista vastuuta asiakkuudestasi ja vapaat kädet toimia. Tätä tukee myös palkkauksemme, joka koostuu kiinteästä osuudesta, sekä laskutukseen sidotusta bonuksesta.Kiinnostuitko?Aloitamme haastattelut tehtävään heti soveltuvan hakijan löytyessä, tavoitteena päästä sopimukseen elokuussa, joten laitathan hakemuksesi palkkatoiveineen meille mahdollisimman pian.Innofactor kasvaa ja kehittyy joka päivä, yhdessä asiakkaidemme ja työntekijöidemme kanssa. Meillä työskentelee yli 550 innostunutta ja osaavaa henkilöä Suomessa, Ruotsissa, Tanskassa ja Norjassa. Innofactor Oyj:n osake on noteerattu arvopaperipörssi NASDAQ Helsinki Oy:n päälistalla.#PeopleFirst | #BeTheRealYou | #CreatingSmiles | #ModernDigitalOrganizationInnofactor kasvaa ja kehittyy joka päivä, yhdessä asiakkaidemme ja työntekijöidemme kanssa. Olemme Pohjoismaiden johtavia Microsoft-pohjaisten ratkaisujen toimittajia. Tarjoamme yrityksille, julkishallinnolle ja muille yhteisöille kaikki Microsoftin keskeiset ratkaisut. Yrittäjälähtöisyytemme pitää asiakkaan tarpeet aina työmme keskiössä. Innofactorin asiakkaina on noin 1000 yritystä, yhteisöä ja julkishallinnon organisaatiota Suomessa, Ruotsissa, Tanskassa, Norjassa ja muualla Euroopassa. Innofactorissa työskentelee yli 500 innostunutta ja osaavaa henkilöä Suomessa, Ruotsissa, Tanskassa ja Norjassa. Innofactor Oyj:n osake on noteerattu arvopaperipörssi NASDAQ Helsinki Oy:n päälistalla, jossa se on liikevaihdolla mitattuna yksi nopeimmin kasvavista yrityksistä.#PeopleFirst | #BeTheRealYou | #CreatingSmiles #ModernDigitalOrganization

Tule asiantuntevaan tiedonhallintaryhmäämme TIETOVARASTOASIANTUNTIJAKSI (Data Analyst). Jos työn merkityksellisyys sekä vakaa, vapaa, avoin ja ennakkoluuloton työyhteisö kiinnostavat, voisi tietotekniikkakeskus olla oiva paikka sinulle!Tietovarastoasiantuntija osallistuu yliopiston tietovaraston, raportointijärjestelmien, tietokantojen ja järjestelmäintegraation kehittämiseen ja ylläpitoon sekä yhteydenpitoon asiakkaisiin ja toimittajiin tietovarasto- ja raportointiasioissa ja on osaltaan vastuussa yliopiston tietovaraston tietosisällön eheydestä, oikeellisuudesta ja soveltuvuudesta käyttötarpeisiin.Sinulla on nyt loistava tilaisuus tulla kehittämään omaa osaamistasi sekä liittyä Suomen parhaan yliopiston IT-porukkaan. Pääset kehittämään koko yliopistomme tietovarastointia laajassa sekä haastavassa, mutta joustavassa toimintaympäristössä.Toivomme sinulta seuraavaa osaamista ja taitoja tehtävässä menestymiseksiTiedonmallinnuksesta ETL-välineistä suomen ja englannin kielen taidosta Eduksesi on osaaminenMonimutkaisesta SQL:sta analytiikkatyökalujen mallien luomisesta sekä käytöstä versionhallintatyökaluista, ketteristä menetelmistä sekä dokumentoinnista Tarjoamme sinulleTyökavereiksi osaavan ja innostuneen kymmenen hengen ryhmän, jonka kanssa voi yhdessä oppia ja kehittyä - välillä onnistumisten, välillä epäonnistumistenkin avulla. Vakaan työympäristön sekä joustavan työn ja vapaa-ajan tasapainon Laajan ja monipuolisen työyhteisön, johon kuuluu asiantuntijoita kaikilta IT-osa-alueilta konesalejakaan unohtamatta. Työn, jolla on merkitystä niin yliopistolle, yliopistolaisille kuin yhteiskunnalle - pääset kurkistamaan monitieteisen yliopiston mitä erilaisimpiin tieteenaloihin ja hallinnon koukeroihin. Tietotekniikkakeskuksen uudet yhteisöllistä toimintaa tukevat työtilat sijaitsevat luonnonläheisessä Viikissä ja tarjoamme luonnollisesti mahdollisuuden yhdistää etätyön lähityöskentelyyn. Monitieteellinen yliopisto tarjoaa myös erinomaiset mahdollisuudet oman osaamisesi kehittämiseen. Unisportin henkilökuntahintaiset edulliset liikuntapalvelut Palkkaus on tehtävään valittavan henkilön kokemuksesta ja osaamisesta riippuen noin 3800-4200 euroa kuukaudessa. Voit myös esittää palkkatoiveen hakemuksen jättämisen yhteydessä.Kiinnostuitko? Lisätietoja tehtävästä antaa tietotekniikka-asiantuntija Tapio Piironen (puh. 02941244 99, tapio.piironen(at)helsinki.fi).Odotamme hakemustasi rekrytointijärjestelmämme kautta viimeistään 15.10.2023. Liitä mukaan ansioluettelo (CV) pdf-muodossa.Yliopistoon työsuhteessa olevat hakijat jättävät hakemuksensa: https://msap.sap.helsinki.fi. Hakujärjestelmään liittyvät yhteydenotot HR:n palveluosoitteeseen: hr-erla(at)helsinki.fi.Lisätietoja Tietotekniikkakeskuksesta voit lukea täältä ja Helsingin yliopistosta täältä. Henkilöstömme (tutummin Tikeläisten) kuvaamia hetkiä arjestamme ja juhlistamme voit katsoa täältä.Helsingin yliopistossa toimiva erillinen laitos Tietotekniikkakeskus on noin kahdensadan henkilön asiantuntijayksikkö, joka vastaa yliopiston tietohallinnosta, tietotekniikkainfrastruktuurista ja -palveluista. Tietotekniikkakeskus tarjoaa oppimista ja ammattitaidon kehittymistä myös omaa tehtäväkuvaa laajemmin, ison ja monipuolisen tietotekniikkaympäristön, osaavia kollegoita ja osaamisen kulttuuria sekä mahdollisuuden työskennellä monitieteisessä tutkimusyliopistossa mielenkiintoisten haasteiden parissa.Helsingin yliopisto on vahva vaikuttaja Suomessa ja maailmalla. Ratkomme ongelmia, jotka koskettavat meistä jokaista. Etsimme vastauksia ilmastonmuutokseen, ravinnon riittävyyteen, kaupungistumiseen, Itämeren suojeluun ja moneen muuhun monitieteiseen kysymykseen. Haluamme jakaa osaamistamme ja vaikuttaa koko maailman parhaaksi – yhdessä.#helsinkiunicareers

Bring your people analytics, social science research and data mining/science skills to a unique team seeking to understand, and shape, the future of the digital workplace. We are interested in technology, of course, but we are also interested in the human mission of enabling the world's brightest and hardest working people to live where they want and work from anywhere. Most of our colleagues could move to a tech hub but they choose Canonical because of our mission and our approach to the workplace.We'd like to understand what really makes a distributed, remote-first workplace work. We think we're pretty good at this (being remote first for almost 20 years), but we know there is a lot still to understand, and the frontier of possibility continues to move outward. We'd like to invest in research, analytics and tooling which raises the bar even further for remote collaboration and organisation.If we are able to build tools that meaningfully improve our cooperation and our satisfaction, then we intend to share our insights with the world, both as a narrative and as SAAS or open source that helps other companies follow in our footsteps.The role of a Workplace Analytics Engineer at CanonicalSupport analytics and data mining in a cross-disciplinary team of organisational psychologists, web front end engineers, back end engineers and statistics / analytics experts to help us build a new definition for the 21st century digital workplace. Collaborate to figure out what really drives productivity, effectiveness and happiness in a remote-first globally distributed company.In addition to your existing people analytics work experience, this role will combine your skills in psychology, data analytics and visualisation, to help create a more effective workplace.Location: This role will be based remotely in the AMER region.All applicants applying must be legally authorized to work in the United States, as we cannot offer visa sponsorship for this job position.What your day will look likeUtilize advanced data analytics to understand how we hire and how we work (productivity, happiness and effectiveness) across a global, remote first organisationFocus on quantitative and qualitative data analytics to find insights and meaningful business outcomesTell the story from the insights through dashboards, visualizations and presentationsDesign and conduct research into trends shaping talent science and remote workCollaborate with stakeholder teams (ex., engineering, information systems, etc) to improve the data and tool ecosystem supporting our digital workplaceWhat we are looking for in youBackground in data science, mathematics, actuarial science, or engineeringFirst work experience in People Analytics Knowledge in advanced statistics, data sciences, coding/scripting languages (Python, R, etc), and databases (SQL, etc)Strength in data analytics and visualization (Looker Studio, Tableau, etc)Ability to translate business questions to key research objectivesAbility to identify the best methodology to execute research, synthesize and analyse findingsExcellent writing and communication skillsWillingness to examine the status quo and resilient in the face of challengesWhat we offer youYour base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilization. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. Together, we can beat cancer.At Varian, a Siemens Healthineers Company, we bring together the world's best talent to realize our vision of a world without fear of cancer. Together, we work passionately to develop and deliver easy-to-use, efficient oncology solutions.We are part of an incredible community of scientists, clinicians, developers, researchers, professionals, and skilled specialists pushing the boundaries of what’s possible, to improve people’s lives around the world. We embrace a culture of inclusivity in which the power and potential of every individual can be unleashed. We spark ideas that lead to positive impact and continued success.If you want to be part of this important mission, we want to hear from you.We are looking for an experienced Clinical System Verification Engineer to join an experienced, highly motivated team to perform system-level software and hardware verification.As a member of an international Interoperability Verification team, you will utilize technical skills for developing, maintaining, and executing test cases for verifying various interfaces, across our treatment delivery systems products.Duties & ResponsibilitiesPlan, execute and coordinate system verification activities to verify medical software for Treatment Planning and Management System and its interfaces, developed by Varian or 3rd party providersDesign and execute test scenarios and test cases, to verify interoperability between treatment planning) and treatment delivery systems by using virtual, simulated or cloud system as well as physical software and hardware in the test lab.Define test environment requirements based on the system verification scope, order and reserve virtual (software, simulated system) as well as physical (test lab, treatment machines) test environments as preparation for the actual verification activity.Create, track, retest and close defects or issues based on failed test execution and during explorative testing.Make recommendations for software releases.Use Application Development Lifecycle Management (ADLM) tool (Microsoft Azure DevOps Server) for release, test case and issue management by adhering to the according work instruction and guidelines.Improve existing test case library by using industry standard test methods according ISTQB.Organize and improve team task and backlog using scrum as agile framework.Collaboration with local and international teams (some travel will be required).Skills And KnowledgeBachelor’s Degree in Radiation Therapy, Medical Physics, Computer Science or comparable technical education.Strong clinical background or working experience in a clinic (preferably in radiotherapy) preferred.Experience in software testing of complex systems.Experience in medical device industry or another regulated environment preferred.Familiar with software installation process on Windows and Citrix Systems.Tester certification (ISTQB/SAQ Certified Tester) is a plus.Excellent interpersonal skills and fluent English, both in written and spoken.Organized and goal oriented with ability to prioritize workload.Strong team player with an international mindset.What We Can OfferInspiring work atmosphere with supporting work communityMeaningful work with the medical domainContinuous learning and personal growth possibilitiesInternational and cross-cultural working environmentNewly opened modern office located in the downtown of HelsinkiVarian is required to comply with all local and applicable regulations that may be associated with vaccine requirements for certain roles.Fighting cancer calls for big ideas.We envision a world without fear of cancer. Achieving this vision takes dedication and commitment from all of us, every single day. That's why we celebrate and value the distinctly beautiful and intersectional identities of each of our employees. We are a mirror of our patient-base, which allows us to innovate. Big ideas come from everywhere, and the best ideas are fostered by our unique individual experiences. At Varian, we encourage you to bring your whole self to work and believe your bold and authentic perspective will help to power more victories over cancer.#TogetherWeFightPrivacy Statement

We are seeking an experienced System and Hardware Enablement Engineer passionate about Linux systems, the RISC-V architecture, Ubuntu, and the open-source community.RISC-V is a first-class architecture in Canonical Ubuntu, and we continue to expand our expertise with it. The Ubuntu Foundations Engineering team maintains and enhances support for RISC-V for the entire Ubuntu stack. This includes engaging with hardware vendors, bringing support for new RISC-V platforms to the Ubuntu distribution, and expanding the software packages available for the RISC-V architecture. The work is critical to system security and reliability. Hence we are looking for a colleague with a very diligent and systematic approach to software engineering.The Ubuntu Foundations Team delivers and maintains the core of the Ubuntu system, the base for the entire Ubuntu family of products and services. Ubuntu strives to deliver the latest and best free software components, in an easy-to-use and highly reliable form. We build on the technical excellence of Debian and bring additional focus and shape to the solutions we offer industry.As a Linux System Engineer, you will work on the architecture, design, and development of core components involved in the enablement and support of the RISC-V architecture for the Ubuntu Distribution, often interacting with the upstream community for projects like U-Boot, OpenSBI, or GRUB. You will also have the opportunity to work closely with various hardware vendors and be part of the enablement of new cutting edge platforms and be part of shaping the future of RISC-V for Linux and Ubuntu.Location: This is a remote work role and can be held in European, Middle East or African time zones.What your day will look likeWork with highly technical team to define and shape the future of RISC-V architecture support for UbuntuWrite high-quality code, create new features, and contribute upstreamContribute features and bug fixes to projects including OpenSBI, U-Boot, GRUB, and the Ubuntu installers. Debug issues and produce high-quality fixesReview code produced by other engineersDiscuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutionsWork with teams focused on Ubuntu for server, desktop, IoT and clouds Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks a year for internal and external eventsWhat we are looking for in youDevelopment experience with early boot software like TF-A, OP-TEE, U-Boot, shim, GRUB, or the Linux kernel. Development experience on RISC-VA love of technology and working with brilliant peopleMotivated, curious, flexible, articulate, and accountableA long-time Linux user with broad interests in the future of LinuxExperience or interest in learning how to package software for Debian and UbuntuEnterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivatedAdditional Skills That You Might Also BringExperience with Debian/Ubuntu based operating system and good understanding of Debian packaging and snaps would also be a considerable advantage.What we offer youYour base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. This is an exciting opportunity to join an industry leading software security team, and help protect the open source community and Ubuntu users from emerging threats. Canonical is building a team to provide security coverage across a wide range of different ecosystems and environments, and work to make the world a better, safer place.As part of the Ubuntu team, you will work with the best and brightest people in technology to monitor, triage, respond to and document new and existing vulnerabilities in open source software. The role will involve collaboration with internal teams and external partners, to identify and prioritize issues and track progress.The role can also include a number of other activities, including security assessment and code review, internal tooling developments, community engagement, security hardening and feature development and industry collaboration participation.This job involves international travel several times a year, usually for one week and requires the ability to be productive in a globally distributed team through self-discipline and self-motivation.What You'll DoAnalyze, fix, and test vulnerabilities in Ubuntu packagesKeep track of vulnerabilities in Ubuntu releases as they are discovered, researched and fixed (using internal software tools)Collaborate with other teams in the Ubuntu community and with upstream developers where appropriate, to exchange or develop vulnerability patches and make sure that Ubuntu includes the very best security featuresAudit source code for vulnerabilitiesWho You AreYou have a thorough understanding of the common categories of security vulnerabilities and techniques for fixing themYou are familiar with coordinated disclosure practicesYou are familiar with open source development tools and methodologiesYou are skilled in one or more of C, Python, go, Rust, Java, Ruby or PHP You have excellent logic, problem-solving, troubleshooting, and decision-making skillsYou can clearly and effectively communicate with the team and Ubuntu community membersWe are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.

The role of a Community Engineer at CanonicalThe Ubuntu Community team at Canonical enables community leaders and participants to get things done in the project, coordinating with Canonical teams and ensuring that community processes are efficient and well run. We don't do the work of the community, but we facilitate that work to ensure that energetic and ambitious community members with their own vision of open source can benefit from the work Canonical does and bring their own flavour of Ubuntu into being, to meet the needs and express the interests of their community.This is an exciting opportunity for a technically proficient person who is passionate about open source software, Linux, and sustainable community building.In this role, you will support community initiatives with your technical skills and strong organizational skills. You can get into the trenches with developers to smooth processes and integrate community plans with Canonical plans for maximum impact. You can encourage and facilitate the creation of new technical projects that enhance the community contribution experience, and you can represent community interests to Canonical teams.You will support and engage with volunteer developers in the Ubuntu community, addressing their concerns and helping them to create successful tools. You will help to ensure their success and the overall autonomy and sustainability of the project. This role is likely a good fit for someone with experience in DevOps, Software Development, Testing or QA, package management, container technology. You will definitely need to be technically skilled with Linux.You will provide the content and technical support to ensure the community stays engaged and informed. This will include regular blog and social media posts about community initiatives, events, accomplishments, and collaborative efforts between Canonical and the Ubuntu community.You will communicate effectively with developers and software engineers and represent not only the Ubuntu community but Canonical as a contributor to the wider Linux ecosystem. Our team attends conferences and expos, and talks about technical community projects and their development processes.Location: This is a Globally remote role.What your day will look likeCollaborate proactively with a distributed teamWrite high quality content to promote and support community initiativesDiscuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions to community problemsWork from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external eventsPotential opportunity to travel more if you wishNurture community contributions to UbuntuEngage with the Ubuntu community through AskUbuntu, IRC, social media, conferences, etcRepresent Ubuntu via speaking engagements at events and conferences. What we are looking for in youYou love technology and working with brilliant peopleYou are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountableYou value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivatedYou have experience with developer tools and open source projectsYou have a clear public record of accomplishments (talks, blog posts, GitHub, Twitter, etc)You have interest and experience with two or more of the following: Ubuntu Linux - kernel or userspace, DevOps, software development, testing and QA, package management, container technologyYou can work autonomously and assume full ownership of objectives as neededYou can be flexible with your time and enjoy working with new technology in a fast-paced environmentYou are experienced working with open source communities and understand the workflow of volunteer contributorsAdditional Skills That You Might Also BringExperience with community managementExperience with Developer advocacyExperience as a software developerExamples of contributions to the Ubuntu CommunityExperience with contributing to open source projectsWhat we offer youYour base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. This is a unique opportunity to use your cryptography and certification skills to enable Ubuntu and its users to operate securely and to remain compliant to FIPS 140 and Common Criteria standards. Haluatko mukaan kehittämään asiakkaidemme modernia digitaalista organisaatiota yhdessä Pohjoismaiden nopeimmin kasvavassa IT-talossa? Haemme nyt Business Central -tiimiimme vahvistukseksi Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central / NAV -kehittäjiä. Toimipisteesi voi sijaita Espoon, Turun tai Lappeenrannan toimistollamme.Tiimin jäsenenä olet rakentamassa tulevaisuuden Microsoft Dynamics Business Central -pohjaisia ratkaisuja. Pääset aitiopaikalle asiakastyöhön miettimään asiakkaidemme kanssa sitä, miten voimme auttaa heidän arkeaan tietojärjestelmien ja prosessien avulla. Saat tueksesi Innofactorin yli 500 rautaista ohjelmistoalan ammattilaista ympäri Pohjoismaita.SinustaSinulla on kokemusta työskentelystä Dynamics NAV:n / Business Centralin parissa ja halu oppia tuotteesta koko ajan lisää. Olet toiminut aikaisemmissa NAV / BC projekteissa kehittäjänä tai arkkitehtinä, ja kehittäminen AL-kielellä on sinulle tuttua. Kokeneena NAV-kehittäjänä haluat kehittää taitojasi ja olet kiinnostunut laajentamaan osaamistasi myös muihin Microsoftin teknologioihin kuten Power Platformiin.Asenteesi on kommunikoiva ja ratkaisuhakuinen, arvostat osaavia kollegoita ja tekemistä yhdessä. Osaamistasi jaat koko tiimin hyödyksi sekä hyödynnät itse tiimin kokemusta. Olet ylpeä työsi jäljestä ja näet sen käytännön ratkaisuna asiakkaille. Arvot ovat sinulle tärkeitä ja olet valmis toimimaan arvojemme mukaisesti – uskot vastuullisuuteen, toimintavapauteen, sekä innovaatioiden avulla luotavaan lisäarvoon ja haluat ansaita asiakkaidemme luottamuksen joka päivä.MeistäInnofactor on ammattilaisten yhteisö, jota leimaavat vapaus ja vastuunotto. Uskomme ihmisten osaamiseen ja kykyyn työskennellä itsenäisesti. Tämä näkyy päivittäisessä tekemisessämme muun muassa kykynä ja rohkeutena hakea innovatiivisia, uusia ratkaisuita omaan työhömme. Innofactorilla on ihmistä ymmärtävä kulttuuri, jossa jokainen voi olla oma itsensä. Toimiva etätyö on meillä arkipäivää ja mahdollistaa työn sujumisen kaikenlaisissa elämäntilanteissa. Ammattilaisen työ on meillä hauskaa!Tuleva tiimisi koostuu tiiviistä joukosta osaavia, motivoituneita ja sitoutuneita kehitysarkkitehteja. Tiimissä ratkomme ongelmia itseohjautuen, kuitenkin jakaen tietoa uusista ideoista koko tiimille. Yhteisissä intresseissämme on kehittää uusien teknologioiden kautta innovatiivisia ratkaisuita asiakkaillemme, sekä viedä jatkuvasti eteenpäin omaa osaamistamme tiiminä ja asiantuntijoina.Pääset osaksi it-talon kasvutarinaa yrityksessä, jonka tavoitteena on olla johtava pilviratkaisujen ja digitalisaation toteuttaja jokaisessa Pohjoismaassa. Kiinnostavan tehtävän lisäksi tarjoamme kilpailukykyiset edut, joustavat työaikajärjestelyt sekä monipuoliset, työnantajan tukemat harrastusmahdollisuudet sekä mukavia yhteisiä tapahtumia muiden innofactorilaisten kanssa!Hae meille!Kiinnostuitko tehtävästä? Kerro meille, miksi juuri sinä olisit paras vahvistus tiimiimme. Aloitamme haastattelut tehtävään heti, joten laitathan hakemuksesi ja palkkatoiveesi meille mahdollisimman pian!Lisätietoja tehtävästä ja meillä työskentelystä voit halutessasi tiedustella People Manager Johanna Ljungqvistilta 040 7294 540 tai johanna.ljungqvist@innofactor.com.Innofactor kasvaa ja kehittyy joka päivä, yhdessä asiakkaidemme ja työntekijöidemme kanssa. Ubuntu is the most widely used Linux distribution in the world, and a strong factor in its broad adoption is the security and reliability the Ubuntu Linux kernels provide for their users. Canonical, the company behind the Ubuntu Linux distribution, has an enduring commitment to not only high quality standards for a distribution upon release, but also to provide ongoing security and maintenance updates for its users for up to 10 years for the Long Term Support (LTS) releases.The Canonical Linux Kernel Team is looking for individuals with a strong sense of determination to provide ongoing support and security updates for the Ubuntu Linux kernels. These tasks can range anywhere from diagnosing and resolving kernel issues reported by end users to assessing the latest CVE security exploit notifications for impact and integrating a resolution. Overall, you will be personally responsible for the continual delivery of updates for many of the variations of version, flavor, and architecture of Linux kernel Ubuntu provides.What your day will look likeCollaborate regularly and proactively with a globally distributed team Respond quickly to assess and mitigate security exploits in the Ubuntu Linux kernelHone your kernel debugging techniques by diagnosing and resolving issues in the kernel reported by customers and the communityMaster the art of Debian and Snap packaging for Linux kernelsTake personal pride in being directly responsible for the integration, packaging, and rigorous testing to deliver updates to millions of consumers worldwideContribute to the improvement of tooling and automation for the delivery and test of Ubuntu Linux kernelsDiscover new means to ensure even greater Ubuntu reliability by adding and improving kernel test coverage and delivery process improvementsUtilizing a strong understand of git workflows, submit, review, and apply kernel patches, working with both internal and external upstream maintainersWhat we are looking for in youWell-organized, self-starting and able to deliver to fixed schedulesStrong commitment to quality processes and documentation standardsDemonstrated ability to present oneself in a professional manner when interacting with colleagues, business partners, and the open source communityAbility to communicate effectively in English, both written and oralSignificant programming experience in CSolid background with gitDemonstrated experience with operating system kernel patching and debuggingAdditional Skills That You Might Also BringSignificant Python and Bash scripting abilityBroad knowledge of the Linux kernel and kernel subsystemsKnowledge/experience with Linux kernel upstream processes and release cyclePrior experience with Ubuntu/Debian/Snap packagingStrong grasp of device drivers, BSP's, and other low level system engineeringContributed to or even maintained an open source project in the past or presentUnderstanding of CVE classificationWhat we offer youYour base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annumAnnual compensation reviewRecognition rewardsAnnual holiday leaveParental LeaveEmployee Assistance ProgrammeOpportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company eventsAbout CanonicalCanonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.Canonical is an equal opportunity employerWe are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Haemme nyt tiimiimme vahvistukseksi Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations -kehittäjiä. Toimipisteesi voi sijaita millä tahansa Suomen toimistollamme ja etätyöskentelykäytäntömme ovat joustavat.Tiimin jäsenenä olet teknisessä roolissa rakentamassa tulevaisuuden Microsoft Dynamics F&O -pohjaisia ratkaisuja. Pääset asiakastyön ytimeen miettimään asiakkaidemme kanssa sitä, miten voimme auttaa heidän arkeaan tietojärjestelmien ja prosessien avulla. Saat tueksesi Innofactorin yli 500 rautaista ohjelmistoalan ammattilaista ympäri Pohjoismaita.SinustaSinulla on kokemusta työskentelystä Dynamics F&O-järjestelmän (tai ainakin AX) parissa ja halu oppia tuotteesta koko ajan lisää. Olet toiminut aikaisemmissa F&O-projekteissa kehittäjänä tai arkkitehtinä ja kehittäminen .NET (C#, X++) -kielellä on sinulle tuttua. F&O-kehittäjänä Microsoft Dynamics -maailmassa olet saanut kosketuspintaa myös Microsoft Azureen ja Power Platformiin. Lisäksi sinulla on jo osaamista tai olet kiinnostunut laajentamaan osaamistasi esimerkiksi API-developmentin, Logic Appsien, Azure DevOpsin tai SQL Serverin alueilla.Asenteesi on kommunikoiva ja ratkaisuhakuinen, arvostat osaavia kollegoita ja tekemistä yhdessä. Osaamistasi jaat koko tiimin hyödyksi sekä hyödynnät itse koko tiimin kokemusta. Olet ylpeä työsi jäljestä ja näet sen käytännön ratkaisuna asiakkaille. Arvot ovat sinulle tärkeitä ja olet valmis toimimaan arvojemme mukaisesti – uskot vastuullisuuteen, toimintavapauteen, sekä innovaatioiden avulla luotavaan lisäarvoon ja haluat ansaita asiakkaidemme luottamuksen joka päivä.MeistäInnofactor on ammattilaisten yhteisö, jota leimaavat vapaus ja vastuunotto. Uskomme ihmisten osaamiseen ja kykyyn työskennellä itsenäisesti. Tämä näkyy päivittäisessä tekemisessämme muun muassa kykynä ja rohkeutena hakea innovatiivisia, uusia ratkaisuita omaan työhömme.Tiimissä ratkomme ongelmia itseohjautuen, kuitenkin jakaen tietoa uusista ideoista koko tiimille. Yhteisissä intresseissämme on kehittää uusien teknologioiden kautta innovatiivisia ratkaisuita asiakkaillemme, sekä viedä jatkuvasti eteenpäin omaa osaamistamme tiiminä ja asiantuntijoina.Pääset osaksi IT-talon kasvutarinaa yrityksessä, jonka tavoitteena on olla johtava pilviratkaisujen ja digitalisaation toteuttaja jokaisessa Pohjoismaassa. Mielenkiintoisten ja haastavien tehtävien lisäksi tarjoamme kilpailukykyiset edut, joustavat työaikajärjestelyt sekä monipuoliset, työnantajan tukemat harrastusmahdollisuudet sekä mukavia yhteisiä tapahtumia muiden innofactorilaisten kanssa!Hae meille!Pyrimme vastaamaan jokaiseen hakemukseen muutaman päivän sisällä ja etenemään rekrytoinneissa nopeasti.Lisätietoja tehtävästä ja meillä työskentelystä voit halutessasi tiedustella People Manager Johanna Ljungqvistilta joko sähköpostitse: johanna.ljungqvist(at)innofactor.com tai puhelimitse numerosta 040 729 4540.Miksi hakea Innofactorille? This role is an opportunity for a hands-on, but literally hands-off, technologist with a passion for Linux to build a career with Canonical and drive the success with those leveraging Ubuntu and open source products. If you have experience of IT operations automation, Infrastructure as Code and a passion for technology, then you will enjoy working with some of the best people in the industry at Canonical.Job SummaryThe IS team at Canonical supports and maintains all of Canonical's IT production services. The team is in charge of running services used by over 60 million Ubuntu users.As an SRE & Gitops engineer you'll be in a unique position to drive operations automation to the next level, both in our own private clouds as well as in the public clouds. We do this by utilizing the best of open source infrastructure as code software, software development practices such as CI/CD pipelines, and Canonical's leading products for software operation automation.In addition to defining the infrastructure as code, you will improve Canonical products and the open-source technologies they're based on by providing critical feedback to developers on how their products operate at scale. This is done by submitting bugs (and sometimes writing pull requests) and collaborating on design and implementations with other teams within the company.You'll be part of a global team of SREs that work together and support each other to provide the best possible services to our company, Canonical's customers and the Ubuntu Community.As a Site Reliability / Gitops Engineer engineer you willApply your experience of IaC to develop infrastructure as code practice within IS by constantly increasing automation and improving IaC processesAutomate software operations for re-usability and consistency across private and public clouds, taking into consideration the complexities of distributed systemsDevelop new features and improve the resilience and scalability of the existing cloud and container portfolio at CanonicalMaintain operational responsibility for all of Canonical's core services, networks, and infrastructureDevelop skills in troubleshooting, capacity planning, and performance investigation, Setting up, maintaining and using observability tools such as Prometheus, Grafana, and Elasticsearch; job-title: Golang System Software Engineer - Containers / Virtualisation
description: We are hiring a Golang software engineer to work on the low level Go codebase sitting between our REST API and the low level C libraries used to manage containers and virtual machines. We are looking for system-level developers with experience in design and data management/modeling.The LXD team is responsible for the design, development and evolution of LXD, a modern system container and virtual machine manager that is widely used on Ubuntu, ChromeOS and other Linux platforms. LXD components span the entire software stack from low-level kernel features to the upper level management REST API and CLI.This is an opportunity for someone who wants to have a meaningful impact on modern cloud computing technologies. Canonical offers a fun, fast-paced team environment and a career full of learning and development.What you will doDesign, implement and document system level Go codeModel data, design database schemas and implement data storage in a dqlite (SQL) databaseMaintain code quality through static analysis, unit and system testsCollaborate proactively with a distributed teamDiscuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutionsWork from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks/year for internal and external eventsWho you areYou have experience programming in Go and CYou are knowledgeable in networking and storage technologiesYou have experience with two or more of: cloud computing, virtualisation, containers, distributed systems, open source communityYou are curious, flexible, articulate and accountableYou value soft skills and are enterprising, thoughtful and self-motivatedYou have a bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degreeCanonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, the world's best free software platform. At Bayer we’re visionaries, driven to solve the world’s toughest challenges and striving for a world where, 'Health for all, Hunger for none' is no longer a dream, but a real possibility. We’re doing it with energy, curiosity, and sheer dedication, always learning from unique perspectives of those around us, expanding our thinking, growing our capabilities and redefining ‘impossible’. There are so many reasons to join us. If you’re hungry to build a varied and meaningful career in a community of brilliant and diverse minds to make a real difference, there’s only one choice.We are currently looking for a creative, innovating and problem-solving Content Creator to join us during a 12-month temporary employment in our Nordic Marketing and Sales Operation Chapter within Bayer Pharmaceuticals. The position is based in Espoo, Finland.As a Content Creator you will lead and update the Content Creation in collaboration with the Campaign Lead. As a part of the role, you will ensure that high standards are applied when creating and uploading content. To succeed, you will need to have an eye for design and knowledge of what ‘good’ content looks like. It's important that you can monitor environmental trends and needs from customers, and by that ensure that creativity will play a major role and that customers’ needs will be prioritized.Your Tasks And ResponsibilitiesEnsure the Campaigns are executed effectively at the country level in collaboration with the Country Manager, Customer Engagement Team Lead and Medical Team. Foster bidirectional communication between the Nucleus Campaigns and the target Country. Collaborate proactively with local squad teams ensuring alignment, collaboration, and co-creation with all cross-functional team members. Customize Campaigns to suit country requirements. Confidently utilize all relevant functionality within eWizard (email tool) to create, edit, and publish new content, including tagging of content modules with core messages, based on briefings and guidance from Campaign Owner & Content Lead. Conduct testing of eWizard assets across devices and ahead of release. Lead the coordination towards creative agency (if needed) and Content Studio to efficiently manage content through the localization process. Collaborate with Campaign Lead by providing early visibility of content production needs, helping them to plan the production pipeline for the market. Plan the production pipeline for the market and highlight content production needs. Be an expert in Content Factory, our library platform where content is uploaded, approved and archived. Design and produce print- and digital assets, like brochures and banners, preferably by using tools within Adobe Cloud. Who You ArePrevious experience in content creation and digital marketing across various channels, especially email/newsletter and website. Proficiency with the Adobe suite, including either Photoshop or inDesign. Experience with moving images is a bonus, such as After Effects and/or Premier. You are digitally savvy and a quick learner of digital content creation tools. Ability to incorporate performance and user insights into content creation. Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to interact effectively with diverse stakeholders and meet high expectations. Sound problem solving skills with the ability to quickly process complex information, and present it clearly and simply. Experience within a larger organization and in the pharma industry is considered as highly advantageous. Ability to utilize team collaboration to create innovative solutions efficiently. You are native in Finnish and fluent in English. In addition, Swedish language skills are considered an advantage. CONTACT DETAILS If you have any questions about the role, please don't hesitate to reach out to the recruitment consultant, Natasha Madlala by email natasha.madlala(at)staffpoint.fi or phone + 358 44 420 4228.Please submit your application along with your salary request in English by the 11th of October. We will review the applications on continuous basis. We reserve the rights to close the advert earlier.Bayer is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all individuals. You have a voice, ideas and perspectives and we want to hear them. Because our success begins with you. Be part of something bigger. Be you. Be Bayer.Functional area: Marketing and SalesSeniority level: Professional

At Iron Mountain we protect what our customers value most, from the everyday to the extraordinary. We build customer value around the world with a passion for preserving the physical, transforming the digital, and respecting the environmental. We pioneered the industry for global records and information management and have established some of the best customer relationships in the industry with 95% of the Fortune 1000 companies among our 225,000 loyal customers. Here, you’ll bring your expertise and creativity to a workplace that thrives on continuous improvement. Here, you’ll be part of a global workforce that embraces the differences among us. And here, we’ll encourage you to Climb Higher for the benefit of our customers and each other. There is so much more, but enough about us. We can’t wait to hear about YOU."Are you a quick learner and want to work in a creative environment? Do you have an interest in customer service and service?"Description :This role is a Hybrid role meaning you will be able to work part time from the office and part time from home. Furthermore, the role is a fixed term with possibility to transfer to a permanent role. For this role at Iron Mountain, you will work to provide exceptional customer service within the Finnish customer service department. Being the first point of contact for all customer enquiries, providing prompt and professional customer support, owning resolution or escalation as needed ensure total customer satisfaction. Answers customer phone inquiries, contacts all departments and investigates customer issues. Process orders received by phone or email while striving to deliver a world-class service in accordance with Service Level Agreements and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs).To fit the role, you must be a motivated person who shows enthusiasm and energy, uses positive language with customers and colleagues, can adapt to changes and be flexible in approach. Have pride and strive to be professional in all dealings with colleagues and customers. We strive to work with the promotion of inclusion and teamwork, a team player who always shows respect for customers and colleagues, pragmatic approach and can demonstrate good work ethic during all interactions in a fair and consistent manner. Furthermore, we work by acting with integrity, therefore it is important that the person is reliable, loyal and shows a high degree of integrity. Not least who can take ownership, which means taking personal ownership of customer issues while following all avenues to ensure a satisfactory outcome.Qualifications And KnowledgeYou have a relevant educational background or have previously worked in customer service or alternatively in the service profession and are used to working in systems. You have at least a few years of documented experience in service work and preferably within a global organization. It is advantageous if you have worked in environments with a wide range of technology, as well as experience in digital document management.Good written and oral communication skillsGood cooperation skillsFlexible and customer-orientedComputer literate - Microsoft Office/G SuiteThorough investigative skillsGood analytical skillsConfident at multitaskingBasic technical understandingCharacteristics/Traits:you are motivated and "hungry"you are a curious team playeryou have a high work ethic and high delivery reliability/delivery abilityyou are solution-focusedyou have high work capacity and can handle stressyou are good at communicating both in writing and orally, in Finnish and EnglishForm of employment/Employment level:Permanent, Full time.Working hours and salary:Fixed term contract 36 months with possibility to transferred into a permanent employmentFixed Monthly salary.Day time.According to company policy as a hybrid workplace with remote and office workLocationFinlandOther information:ATTENTION! The selection work will take place continuously, which is why we recommend that you do not wait but that you make your application as soon as possible. Apply for the position by registering your CV and a personal letter already today.Category: Customer SupportIron Mountain Incorporated, founded in 1951, is the global leader for storage and information management services. Trusted by more than 225,000 organizations around the world in approximately 50 countries, Iron Mountain stores and protects billions of valued assets, including critical business information, highly sensitive data, and cultural and historical artifacts.Providing solutions that include information management, digital transformation, secure storage, secure destruction, as well as data centers, cloud services, and art storage and logistics, Iron Mountain helps customers lower cost and risk, comply with regulations, recover from disaster, and enable a digital way of working.Our Cores Values and Code of Ethics are our north star. They provide a solid base for how we do business and behave every day, so each one of us can experience exceptional.If you have a physical or mental disability that requires special accommodations, please let us know by sending an email to accommodationrequest@ironmountain.com. See the Supplement to learn more about Equal Employment Opportunity.Iron Mountain is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. Presales Specialistin tehtävänä on keskustella pienten ja keskisuurten yritysten päättäjien kanssa ja luoda uusia myyntimahdollisuuksia. Etsit ja tavoitat potentiaaliset asiakkaat, joille esittelet asiantuntevalla tavalla parhaiten heidän tarpeisiinsa sopivat ratkaisut. Olet siis ensikontakti asiakkaaseen ja tuotat myyjille liidejä, joista he pääsevät luomaan voittavia keskusteluita, ja tämä tekeekin roolistasi tiimissä erityisen tärkeän.Etsimämme henkilö omaa sinnikkään asenteen ja koska tehtäväsi on vakuuttaa yrityspäättäjät, vaatii rooli hyviä kommunikointi- ja neuvottelutaitoja sekä kykyä kuunnella ja vaikuttaa.Työ on sopivan haastavaa, johon kattava perehdytys, selkeät tavoitteet sekä valmentava työkulttuuri antavat sinulle parhaat lähtökohdat onnistua. Näyttöjen kautta sinulla on mahdollisuus edetä tiimissä myös myyjän rooliin, jossa vastaat myyntiprosessista kokonaisvaltaisesti tekemällä tarjoukset ja lopulta kaupaksi asti!Mitä toivomme sinulta?Tavoitteellista otetta työntekoonHalua auttaa yrityksiäOptimistista suhtautumista haastavissakin tilanteissaHalua kehittyä myyntityössä, sekä can do -asennettaTarjoamme sinulle:Kattavan myynnin ammattilaisten toteuttaman Bookers Sales Avenue - valmennusohjelman tukemaan urakehitystäsiEpassi flexin sekä laajennetun työterveyshuollon koejan ylitettyäHalutessasi mahdollisuuden opiskella liiketalouden ammattitutkinto oppisopimuksellaTietenkin koko Bookersin lähes 250 huipputyökaveria ja todistetusti koukuttavan ja mukaansa tempaavan yrityskulttuurin sekä modernit työtilat työssäsi viihtymiseksiTyöaika: Maanantaista perjantaihin toimistoaikoinaAloitus: Sopimuksen mukaanPaikka: Helsinki, Sörnäinen - hyvien kulkuyhteyksien varrella!Palkka: Aloittavan Presales Specialistin tavoitetapalkka on 2200€, joka muodostuu takuupalkasta sekä provisioista.Mitä nyt? Jätä hakemus ja me olemme sinuun yhteydessä. Rekrytointiprosessimme ovat tehokkaat, joten voitkin odottaa yhteydenottoa hyvin nopeasti. Tehtävä täytetään heti sopivien henkilöiden löydyttyä! Eveliina Mäki, RekrytointivastaavaPuh: 050 358 8901

Bring your people analytics, social science research and data mining/science skills to a unique team seeking to understand, and shape, the future of the digital workplace. We are interested in technology, of course, but we are also interested in the human mission of enabling the world's brightest and hardest working people to live where they want and work from anywhere. Most of our colleagues could move to a tech hub but they choose Canonical because of our mission and our approach to the workplace.We'd like to understand what really makes a distributed, remote-first workplace work. We think we're pretty good at this (being remote first for almost 20 years), but we know there is a lot still to understand, and the frontier of possibility continues to move outward. We'd like to invest in research, analytics and tooling which raises the bar even further for remote collaboration and organisation.If we are able to build tools that meaningfully improve our cooperation and our satisfaction, then we intend to share our insights with the world, both as a narrative and as SAAS or open source that helps other companies follow in our footsteps.The role of a Workplace Analytics Engineer at CanonicalSupport analytics and data mining in a cross-disciplinary team of organisational psychologists, web front end engineers, back end engineers and statistics / analytics experts to help us build a new definition for the 21st century digital workplace. Collaborate to figure out what really drives productivity, effectiveness and happiness in a remote-first globally distributed company.In addition to your existing people analytics work experience, this role will combine your skills in psychology, data analytics and visualisation, to help create a more effective workplace.Location: This role will be based remotely in the EMEA and AMER regions.What your day will look likeUtilise advanced data analytics to understand how we hire and how we work (productivity, happiness and effectiveness) across a global, remote first organisationFocus on quantitative and qualitative data analytics to find insights and meaningful business outcomesTell the story from the insights through dashboards, visualisations and presentationsDesign and conduct research into trends shaping talent science and remote workCollaborate with stakeholder teams (ex., engineering, information systems, etc) to improve the data and tool ecosystem supporting our digital workplaceWhat we are looking for in youAn exceptional academic track record with a BA/BSc or Masters degree in data science, mathematics, actuarial science, or engineeringDemonstrable work experience in People AnalyticsKnowledge in advanced statistics, data sciences, coding/scripting languages (Python, R, etc), and databases (SQL, etc)Strength in data analytics and visualisation (Looker Studio, Tableau, etc)Ability to translate business questions to key research objectivesAbility to identify the best methodology to execute research, synthesise and analyse findingsExcellent writing and communication skillsWillingness to examine the status quo and resilient in the face of challengesWhat we offer youYour base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annumAnnual compensation reviewRecognition rewardsAnnual holiday leaveParental LeaveEmployee Assistance ProgrammeOpportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company eventsAll applicants applying must be legally authorized to work in the United States, as we cannot offer visa sponsorship for this job opening.About CanonicalCanonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.Canonical is an equal opportunity employerWe are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

The role of a Social Media Marketing Specialist at CanonicalWe're on the look out for a brilliant Social Media Marketing Specialist to join our team and take our communications to the next level. Our social media provides a window between the people who make our products and those who use them. Informatica, Data warehouse and ETL specialistsStep into a well-established company known for its expertise in crafting advanced IT solutions and services exclusively designed for the dynamic financial sector. We have a strong foundation and a deep understanding of multi-channel financial services. Our offerings, which include banking systems and data management, are comprehensive and cost-effective. We are dedicated to delivering innovative solutions that empower our clients' growth and success in a competitive business environment. Together, we're on the path to achieving shared success.Our team consists of around 400 experienced professionals, each excelling in their respective fields. We cover a wide range of disciplines, from mobile and online service design to mainframe environments, project management, and product development.A Sneak Peek at Your Role:We're looking for a skilled and solution-focused individual to join us. As a valuable member of our team, your ability to create modern data solutions, along with your expertise in technical cloud solutions, strong database skills, and a clear understanding of data modeling, will be highly valuable. While coding skills are important, we also appreciate a well-rounded skill set.As our Data team expands, we're also growing our Informatica division to meet the increasing demands of our growing customer base.Required Skills & Qualifications: Proficiency in Informatica is essential. Mastery of Informatica PowerCenter and Informatica Developer. Knowledge of data warehousing and data engineering is a plus. In return for your enthusiasm, we offer certifications and opportunities for professional growth. Be part of a compact and agile organisation where you can contribute to shaping and building a company in its exciting early stages.Explore Your Earnings Potential:Expect a salary range of EUR 5000-8000. job-title: NewFellows Goes Tech -koulutusohjelma I Haku päättynyt
description: Hakuaika suosittuun NewFellows-koulutusohjelmaan on nyt auki! Tulevan NewFellows Goes Tech -koulutusohjelman kautta etsimme uusia osaajia työskentelemään Fellowmindille ohjelmistokehityksen pariin. Tulemme palkkaamaan koulutusohjelman kautta 15 uutta IT-alan ammattilaista monipuolisiin IT-alan työtehtäviin. Sinun ei tarvitse olla valmis tekijä. Koulutamme sinut tulevaan työtehtävääsi sovelluskehittäjänä.Haluamme kasvattaa sinusta sovelluskehityksen asiantuntijan joko integraatioiden, Microsoft Dynamics 365- tai Power Platform -teknologioiden pariin. Sovelluskehittäjänä Fellowmindilla pääset hyppäämään kiinnostavaan ja monipuoliseen tekniseen rooliin IT-alalle, josta tekeminen ja uuden oppiminen ei lopu!Solmimme heti alusta lähtien kanssasi vakituisen työsopimuksen ja panostamme osaamisesi kehittämiseen. Alan parhaiden kouluttajien ja koulutusten lisäksi saat tukea ja neuvoja kokeneemmilta ohjelmistokehittäjiltä, jotka jakavat sinulle osaamistaan mentorina sekä asiakasprojekteissa että arjessa.NewFellows Goes Tech -ohjelmaan valitut henkilöt palkataan suoraan työsuhteeseen Fellowmindille ja heidän kanssaan solmitaan heti toistaiseksi voimassa oleva työsopimus.Koulutusohjelman alkuvaiheessa painopiste on vahvasti uuden oppimisessa ja koulutuksessa, jonka jälkeen pääset hyödyntämään ja syventämään taitojasi käytännön asiakastyössä. Sinun ei tarvitse olla valmis tekijä, koulutamme sinut tulevaan rooliisi.Oppiminen jatkuu asiakasprojekteissa, joissa pääset syventämään osaamistasi entisestään uusien teknologioiden ja koodauksen parissa - samalla auttaen asiakkaitamme liiketoimintakriittisten ratkaisujen kehittämisessä.Tuleva Roolisi On Aluksi Joku SeuraavistaMeillä pääset kasvamaan monipuoliseksi IT-alan ammattilaiseksi ja tuleva työroolisi muodostuu aikaisemman teknisen osaamisesi, työkokemuksesi sekä kiinnostuksesi mukaan.IntegraatiokehittäjäMicrosoft D365 -sovelluskehittäjäMicrosoft Power Platform -asiantuntija ja -sovelluskehittäjä"Työssä täytyy ratkoa teknisiä asioita, mutta tiimityötaidot ovat yhtä tärkeitä, sillä työtä tehdään asiakkaille."Miia, integraatiokehittäjäEduksesi Katsomme Osaamisen Esimerkiksi Seuraavista Osa-alueistaToivomme, että olisit päässyt siis jo koodaamisen makuun joko koulutuksen, työn tai harrastuneisuuden kautta.Microsoft Dynamics 365 tai Microsoft Power Platform C# / Java  Microsoft Azure  Web API:t  SQL  Sinun ei tarvitse kuitenkaan olla täysin valmis ohjelmistokehittäjä tai tekninen ammattilainen, sillä meille eniten merkitsee intosi ja motivaatiosi oppia uutta sekä päästä käsiksi uusiin teknologioihin ja asiakkaidemme auttamiseen. Koulutamme sinut tulevaan työtehtävään sekä käytössä oleviin teknologioihin. Työ IT-alalla on jatkuvaa oppimista!Fellowmindilla menestyt, kun työskentelytyylisi on vastuuntuntoinen, asiakaslähtöinen ja haluat kehittyä jatkuvasti omassa työssäsi. Teet töitä ammattitaidolla, mutta sopivan rennolla otteella. Itseohjautuvuuden lisäksi työskentelet sujuvasti myös osana asiakas- tai projektitiimiä, jotta saamme varmistettua asiakkaalle parhaan mahdollisen ratkaisun. Asiakkaidemme ja ympäristömme kansainvälistyessä toivomme sinulta suomen lisäksi myös sujuvaa englannin kielen taitoa.Palkallinen koulutusohjelma ja vakituinen työsuhde: Tarjoamme työn ohella kattavan koulutuksen, jossa kasvat alan ammattilaiseksi! Kehität erittäin arvostettua osaamista Microsoftin Dynamics -, Azure- sekä integraatioympäristöissä niin koulutuksen kuin käytännön työtehtävien kautta.Alan parhaat kouluttajat ja kokeneet kehittäjät mentoreina: Tarjoamme sinulle osaamistasi tukevan lyhyen koulutuskokonaisuuden huippuammattilaistemme johdolla ja saat mahdollisuuden suorittaa alalla arvostettuja sertifiointeja. Kokeneet kehittäjät ovat tukenasi mentoreina.Monipuoliset asiakasprojektit: Pääset myös soveltamaan kykyjäsi ja koulutuksissa opittua oikeissa asiakasprojekteissa heti alussa olevan tiiviimmän koulutusosion jälkeen. Olet mukana rakentamassa kriittisiä liiketoimintaratkaisuja ja todentamaan niiden hyötyjä asiakkaidemme liiketoiminnalle.Kilpailukykyiset työsuhde-edut: Sinulle kuuluu palkan lisäksi myös kilpailukykyiset työsuhde-etumme, joita ovat mm. hierontaetu, kuntosalietu ja ilmaiset ohjatut ryhmäliikuntatunnit sekä paljon jaksamiseen ja virikkeellisyyteen liittyviä Fellowmind-tapahtumia.Koulutamme ja rekrytoimme nyt sinut ja tulevat kollegaasi NewFellows Goes Tech -ohjelman kautta asiakaslähtöisiksi sovelluskehittäjiksi vauhdittamaan kasvuamme niin Helsingissä, Tampereella kuin Vaasassa sekä muilla Fellowmindin toimistoilla Turussa, Lahdessa, Jyväskylässä, Kuopiossa, Oulussa ja Seinäjoella.Hakuaika on päättynyt vuoden 2023 koulutusohjelmaan. Pysy kuulolla tulevista ohjelmistamme somessa sekä verkostoitumalla kanssamme.

job-title: Informatica, Data warehouse and ETL specialists
description: Embrace a Thriving Journey with a Premier Financial Solutions Innovator!Unlock the doors to a well-established company that stands as a beacon of expertise, crafting cutting-edge IT solutions and services exclusively tailored for the dynamic financial sector. With deep-seated roots and a commanding grasp of multi-channel financial services, we pave the way with comprehensive, cost-effective offerings, encompassing banking systems, data management, and beyond. Our commitment to excellence empowers our clients with innovative solutions, propelling their growth and evolution in the competitive business landscape. Together, we are poised for shared success.Our robust workforce of approximately 400 seasoned professionals, each a virtuoso in their respective domains, forms the backbone of our operation. Our team thrives across diverse disciplines, spanning mobile and online service design, mainframe environments, and the full spectrum of project management and product development undertakings.A Glimpse at Your Role:We are in search of an adept, solution-oriented individual to join our ranks. As a valuable addition to our team, your prowess in crafting contemporary data solutions, coupled with technical cloud expertise, robust database skills, and a nuanced comprehension of data modeling, will be invaluable. While coding prowess is naturally an asset, we warmly welcome your comprehensive skill set.As we expand our Data team, we are also augmenting our INFORMATICA division to meet the burgeoning demands of our ever-growing customer base.Required Skills & Qualifications: Proficiency Informatica is key. Mastery of Informatica PowerCenter and Informatica Developer. Expertise in data warehousing, and data engineering also a plus. Familiarity with PostgreSQL, ETL processes, Data Vault methodology, and Netezza.Beneficial Expertise:SQL acumen, ERP systems, SSAS, and SSIS.Embracing the Benefits: A diverse and dynamic office environment that fosters innovation and creativity. Informatica and Data Warehousing SpecialistInformation:Our Client offers an exciting opportunity to join their talented team and partake in their rapid expansion and ambitious plans for the year 2023-2024. This company is based in Helsinki and specializes in providing integration solutions for a variety of different clients. More specifically, they offer the capability to efficiently process and integrate data from various customer sources and applications. This functionality spans a wide range of environments including on-premises, private, public, hybrid, and multi-cloud setups.By becoming a part of this accomplished team, you'll be joining professionals from diverse fields such as Utilities, Electricity, Manufacturing, Trade Logistics, Airlines, and International Enterprises.Skills and requirements: You are familiar with system integration. Incentives based on personal performance in terms of billings. Engagement with the latest and most innovative technologies.To apply, or if you have any further questions, you can contact Recruitment Consultant Jennie Selen via email j.selen@nigelfrank.com.Nigel Frank Internationalis the global leader in Microsoft technology recruitment. Since 2006, we've found over 19,000 permanent and contract Microsoft professionals for partners, ISVs, and end users in the ecosystem. For more information, visit www.nigelfrank.com

job-title: End Customer Role - Dynamics 365 Finance Specialist
description: Great opportunity for Dynamics AX / 365 Finance specialists to have an important role at an End Customer.Our Client is a 1000+ employee international company who have been rolling Dynamics 365 out to several of their branches around the Nordics.They have been extremely profitable the last few years and have no signs of slowing down. job-title: Embedded & Desktop Linux Systems Engineer - Optimisation
description: Work across the full Linux stack from kernel through GUI to optimise Ubuntu, the world's most widely used Linux desktop and server, for the latest silicon.The role is a fast-paced, problem-solving role that's challenging yet very exciting. The right candidate must be resourceful, articulate, and able to deliver on a wide variety of solutions across PC and IoT technologies. Our teams partner with specialist engineers from major silicon companies to integrate next-generation features and performance enhancements for upcoming hardware.Location: This is a Globally remote roleWhat your day will look likeDesign and implement the best Ubuntu integration for the latest IoT and server-class hardware platforms and software stacksWork with partners to deliver a delightful, optimised, first class Ubuntu experience on their platformsTake a holistic approach to the Ubuntu experience on partner platforms with inputs on technical plans, testing strategy, quality metricsParticipate as technical lead on complex customer engagements involving complete system architectures from cloud to edgeHelp our customers integrate their apps, SDKs, build device OS images, optimize applications with Ubuntu Core, Desktop and ServerWork with the most advanced operating systems and application technologies available in the enterprise world. Joining Canonical, you will partner with bright minds from all over the world, and work with an exciting set of new technologies in a fast growing company with a truly unique and ambitious vision to build a better platform with free software. You will work with customers on exciting IoT and server platforms and technologies, built to support different verticals: from robots to data centers, from telco to retail.What we are looking for in youYou love technology and working with brilliant peopleYou have a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, STEM or similar You have experience with Linux packaging (Debian, RPM, Yocto)You have experience working with open source communities and licencesYou have experience working with C, C++You can work in a globally distributed team through self-discipline and self-motivation. Additional Skills That You Might Also BringExperience with graphics stacksGood understanding of networking - TCP/IP, DHCP, HTTP/RESTBasic understanding of security best practices in IoT or server environmentsGood communication skills, ideally public speaking experienceIoT / Embedded experience – from board and SoC, BMCs, bootloaders and firmware to OS, through apps and servicesSome experience with Docker/OCI containers/K8sWhat we offer youYour base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annumAnnual compensation reviewRecognition rewardsAnnual holiday leaveParental LeaveEmployee Assistance ProgrammeOpportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company eventsAbout CanonicalCanonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.Canonical is an equal opportunity employerWe are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Equinix is the world’s digital infrastructure company, operating 240+ data centers across the globe and providing interconnections to all the key clouds and networks. Businesses need one place to simplify and bring together fragmented, complex infrastructure that spans private and public cloud environments. Our global platform allows customers to place infrastructure wherever they need it and connect it to everything they need to succeed.We are a fast-growing global company with 20 years of continuous growth. Through our innovative portfolio of high-performance products and services, we have created the largest, most active global ecosystem of 10,000+ companies, including 2,100 networks and 3,000+ cloud and IT service providers in 32 countries spanning six continents.  Joining our operations team means that you will be at the forefront of all we do, maintaining critical facilities infrastructure as part of a close-knit team delivering best-in-class service to our data center customers. We embrace diversity in thought and contribution and are committed to providing an equitable work environment. that is foundational to our core values as a company and is vital to our success.Job SummaryHas a substantial understanding of the job while working on assignments that are moderately difficult requiring judgement in resolving issues or making recommendations. Focus is on moderately difficult tasks, using substantial understanding of standard operating procedure. Ensures vendor maintenance activities are carried out as per Equinix's standard operating proceduresIn cooperation with vendors, supports modifications to technical files for plants and equipment ensuring files and builds are up-to-dateSite Administration & Incident SupportPerforms moderately difficult site logs for permits, such as Maintenance Operation Protocol (MOPs) and scriptsIdentifies Single Points of Failure (SPOFs) and makes recommendationsResponds to all moderately difficult on-site incidents, including failures, problems and delaysUses substantial understanding in following operating procedures to support on-site administrationWork Orders & Additional ProjectsCompletes routine work requests and circuit installationsTroubleshoots and maintains office equipment (if necessary); supports auxiliary equipment and machines with problem solving and repairs to avoid/minimize downtimeMakes minor changes to mechanical, electrical and specialized systems, as directedCarries out infrastructure projectsCollaborationCollaborates with others to resolve moderately difficult facility incidentsEffectively collaborates within the department; may mentor team members on general maintenance activitiesProvides stakeholders of inventory needs in order to maintain optimal stock levels of critical parts and equipmentMay recommend infrastructure projectsQualificationsTypical Degree & Years of ExperienceTypically requires a high school diploma and proven years of equivalent work experienceEquinix is committed to ensuring that our employment process is open to all individuals, including those with a disability.
