job-title: Kokenut johtamisen ja organisaatioiden kehittäjä / valmentaja
description: Verona Consulting on kunnianhimoinen joukko osaajia, joiden intohimona on liiketoiminnan, ihmisten ja organisaatioiden uudistaminen. Tuemme asiakkaitamme uudistumisessa, strategian luomisessa ja sen konkreettisessa toteuttamisessa. Kyvykkyytemme pohjana on vahva kokemus, tutkimustieto ja näkemyksellisyys, joka syntyy yhdessä tekemisen kautta. Meillä työskentelet alan huippuosaajien kanssa ja laajennat moniosaajahankkeissa omaa osaamistasi. Teemme sekä julkisen että yksityisen sektorin asiakkaillemme merkittäviä uudistumisen hankkeita, joissa asiantuntijana olet vaikuttamassa tulevaisuuden suomalaisen yhteiskunnan ja yritysmaailman kehittämiseen. Haemme nyt osaavaan joukkoomme kokeneita johtamisen ja organisaatioiden kehittäjiä sekä valmentajia. Etsimme asiakkaidemme strategisten muutosten vauhdittajia; rohkeita kollegoita, jotka pystyvät haastamaan toiminta- ja ajattelutapoja. Työskentelet luontevasti johtamisen strategisella ja operatiivisella tasolla ja sinulla on kokemusta organisaatioiden ja johtamisen kehittämisestä, johdon konsultoinnista sekä esihenkilöiden ja johdon valmennuksesta.  Menestyminen asiakasprojekteissa edellyttää liiketoiminnan ymmärrystä ja käsitystä organisaatioiden toimintalogiikasta sekä uudistamisesta. Sinulla on kyky hahmottaa asiakkaiden uudistumisen tarpeita sekä tarjota juuri niihin soveltuvat kehittämisen tavat. Innostut myynnistä ja asiakassuhteiden rakentamisesta. Nautit ratkaisuiden rakentamisesta tiiviissä yhteistyössä asiakkaan ja kollegoiden kanssa. Olemme myös itse organisaationa vahvassa kehitysvaiheessa, joten toivomme sinulta halua ja kykyä myös osallistua meidän oman toimintamme kehittämiseen. Työskentelemme asiakashankkeissamme sekä englanniksi että suomeksi, minkä vuoksi molempien kielten sujuva kielitaito on välttämätön.  Onnistuaksesi tässä tehtävässä sinulla todennäköisesti on: Aikaisempaa kokemusta vastaavista tehtävistä vähintään 10 vuoden ajalta Vahvaa näyttöä organisaatioiden ja johtamisen kehittämisen kokonaisuuksien kehittämisestä ja läpiviennistä Kokemusta johtoryhmien kanssa työskentelystä ja johdon konsultoinnista Monipuolinen työkalupakki konsultoinnin, valmennuksen ja fasilitoinnin saralta Hyvät vuorovaikutustaidot ja halu toimia erilaisten ihmisten kanssa Kykyä ja halua hypätä nopeasti uuden äärelle  Positiivinen sekä ratkaisu- ja kehitysorientoitunut asenne Ihmislähtöinen ja empaattinen elämänasenne niin itseäsi kuin muita kohtaan Ylempi korkeakoulututkinto Tarjoamme sinulle monipuolisia ja haastavia kehittämistehtäviä osana osaavaa, motivoitunutta ja innostavaa työyhteisöä. Meillä pääset työskentelemään laajasti yritysten sekä julkishallinnon projektien parissa. Työmme keskeinen voimavara ovat työyhteisömme jäsenet ja yhdessä tekeminen. Asiakasymmärrys, yhteistyö ja luottamus ovat meille tärkeitä arvovalintoja niin asiakkaiden kuin kollegoiden kanssa. Toimistomme sijaitsee keskeisellä paikalla Helsingin keskustassa hyvien kulkuyhteyksien varrella. Työskentelemme joustavasti hybridimallilla. Tuemme henkilöstömme hyvinvointia kattavin työsuhde-eduin sekä laajan työterveyshuollon palveluin.  Kiinnostuitko? Mikäli ammatillinen intohimosi on suuntautunut johtamistaitojen ja organisaatioiden kehittämiseen, haluamme kuulla sinusta pikimmiten. Kerrothan siis meille itsestäsi, osaamisestasi ja motivaatiostasi lähettämällä hakemuksesi ja ansioluettelosi viimeistään 25.10.2023 rekrytointijärjestelmämme kautta. Käymme hakemuksia läpi jo hakuaikana.  Tehtävästä lisätietoja antaa Executive Consultant Henna Ahtola. Hennan (040 521 1068, henna.ahtola@verona.fi) tavoittaa parhaiten ke 4.10. 13-15, pe 6.10. klo 8.30-9.30 tai ke 11.10. klo 9-11.

This position is a shared position between Aalto University and University of HelsinkiAalto University is where science and art meet technology and business. We shape a sustainable future by making research breakthroughs in and across our disciplines, sparking the game changers of tomorrow and creating novel solutions to major global challenges. Our community is made up of 12 000 students, 400 professors and close to 4 000 other faculty and staff working on our dynamic campus in Espoo, Greater Helsinki, Finland. Diversity is part of who we are, and we actively work to ensure our community’s diversity and inclusiveness. This is why we warmly encourage qualified candidates from all backgrounds to join our community.The University of Helsinki is Finland’s oldest and largest academic institution, an international scholarly community of 40,000 students and researchers. In international university rankings, the University of Helsinki usually ranks among the top 100 universities in the world. The University of Helsinki is seeking solutions to global challenges and engendering new thinking for the benefit of humanity. The coordinator will be working tightly with the university’s sustainability and responsibility team as well as the team from Helsinki Institute of Sustainability Science (HELSUS). HELSUS contributes to sustainability transformations of societies by means of inter- and transdisciplinary research and education. HELSUS co-creates knowledge through research, experiments, living labs, and best practices for national and international policy, the private sector and the civil society.Are you an experienced event planner with a passion to make the world a better place?We are now looking for a Sustainability Science Days coordinatorSustainability Science Days (SSD) is a conference event organised by Aalto University and the University of Helsinki. The SSD conference brings together sustainability scientists from all fields of science across the planet. https://www.helsinki.fi/en/conferences/sustainability-science-days-conference-2022We are looking for a coordinator to lead the development and management of this annual conference. Both universities are committed to develop SSD to become a globally recognized transdisciplinary event for sustainability sciences and societal change makers in public and private sectors. Your task is to coordinate the development work and the event management work among relevant teams at Aalto University and University of Helsinki. Join us in shaping sustainable futures! The next SSD will be organized together with the world’s largest sustainability science and innovation conference SRI and will further emphasize global collaboration. https://sricongress.org/This is a fixed-term full-time position until the end of December, 2025.Your role and goalsProject and budget management of the eventResponsible coordinator of the annual event: communication, network building, partnerships and event management, advertisingFind new partnerships and funding, both private and publicDevelop the private sector partner and sponsor networks, together with relevant teams at both universitiesYour network and teamYou will be a part of Aalto Solutions for Sustainability team and University of Helsinki team, i.e. you will divide your worktime between UH and Aalto. You will also have the support of the event management, partnership and communication teams from both universities.Your Experience And AmbitionsWhat we expect from you?Master’s degree or a vocational University degree of comparative levelFluency in EnglishPrevious experience in multi stakeholder project management and international eventsWe would like you to haveExtensive experience in event management.Experience in working with various groups with different expertiseExcellent collaboration skills and the ability to inspire and encourage othersAmbition for networking and communicationCreativity and curiosity to develop new ways of workingPassion for building a more sustainable futureExperience of working in an international, academic work environment, and knowledge on sustainability science is an advantageWhat Do We OfferMeaningful and inspiring environment. We are proud of shaping sustainable futures. We inspire game changers, and renew societies with research-based knowledge and creativity.Culture that inspires and includes everyone. All our work is guided by the values of the two universities: truth, responsibility, inclusivity, courage, freedom, collaboration and wellbeing. Responsible and meaningful role catalyzing unique collaboration between two leading Finnish universities to make a real impact towards multidisciplinary, systemic sustainability transitions.Independent role with support, coaching and sparring when you feel you need it. There is great freedom in your role, and we have a flexible modern working culture.Great possibilities for competence development and learning. Our vast array of professional development opportunities means you will have the chance to participate in staff trainings based on your interests and needs. We value work-life balance and well-being in all aspects of life.Ready to apply?To apply, please share the following application materials with us through our recruitment site:Motivational letter: Describe why you would be an ideal candidate for this position. Be as concrete as you can – e.g. share a story of a recent accomplishment and of how would you envision to develop Sustainability Science Days!Curriculum vitaeIf you are an Aalto employee, please apply via our internal Workday system > Internal Jobs.If you wish to hear more about the position, you can reach out toHead of Sustainable Solutions, Aalto University Jussi Impiö Jussi.m.impio@aalto.fiSenior Specialist, sustainability and responsibility, University of Helsinki, Riina Koivuranta, riina.koivuranta@helsinki.fiWe will go through applications and may invite suitable candidates to interview already during the application period. The call is open until 10.11.2023. We aim to have a transparent and equal recruitment process, so feel free to ask us for feedbackIN FINNISH / SUOMEKSIKestävyyskonferenssin koordinaattorin tehtävä on Aalto-yliopiston ja Helsingin yliopiston yhteinen.Aalto-yliopistossa tiede ja taide kohtaavat tekniikan ja talouden. Rakennamme kestävää tulevaisuutta saavuttamalla läpimurtoja avainalueillamme ja niiden yhtymäkohdissa. Samalla innostamme tulevaisuuden muutoksentekijöitä ja luomme ratkaisuja maailman suuriin haasteisiin. Yliopistoyhteisöömme kuuluu 13 000 opiskelijaa ja yli 4500 työntekijää, joista 400 on professoreita. Kampuksemme sijaitsee Espoon Otaniemessä. Monimuotoisuus on osa meitä, ja teemme jatkuvaa työtä yhteisömme monimuotoisuuden ja syrjimättömyyden varmistamiseksi. Siksi kannustammekin päteviä hakijoita taustasta riippumatta liittymään yhteisöömme.Helsingin yliopisto on yksi maailman parhaista tutkimusyliopistoista – yli 30 000 opiskelijan ja 8 000 työntekijän kansainvälinen tieteen, tutkimuksen, oppimisen ja rohkean ajattelun yhteisö. Uskomme tieteidenvälisen tutkimuksen ja rajoja rikkovan yhteistyön voimaan löytää ratkaisuja ja luoda toivoa paremman ja kestävämmän tulevaisuuden puolesta. Meitä yhdistävät arvomme totuus, sivistys, vapaus ja yhteisöllisyys, sekä halu tehdä merkityksellisiä töitä. Tule mukaan tekemään työtä tulevaisuudelle – maailman parhaaksi. Koordinaattorina työskentelet tiiviisti yliopiston kestävyys- ja vastuullisuustiimin sekä Helsingin yliopiston Kestävyystieteen instituutin (HELSUS) tiimin kanssa. HELSUS yhdistää kestävyystieteen tutkimuksen ja koulutuksen yhdeksästä tiedekunnasta ja kolmelta kampukselta. Instituutti osallistuu yhteiskunnan kestävyysmuutokseen ja edistää kestäviin ratkaisuihin siirtymistä tieteidenvälisen sekä poikkitieteellisen tutkimuksen ja koulutuksen avulla.Oletko kokenut tapahtumakoordinaattori, joka haluaa olla mukana rakentamassa kestävää tulevaisuutta?Haemme nyt koordinaattoria Sustainability Science Days konferenssille.Sustainability Science Days (SSD) on Aalto-yliopiston ja Helsingin yliopiston yhdessä järjestämä kansainvälinen kestävyystieteiden konferenssi. SSD- kokoaa yhteen kestävyyden tutkijoita ja yhteiskunnallisia muutoksentekijöitä kaikilta tieteen ja yhteiskunnan aloilta ympäri maailmaa. Lue lisää täältä. Etsimme tapahtumakoordinaattoria johtamaan tapahtuman järjestelyjä. Molemmat yliopistot ovat sitoutuneet kehittämään SSD:stä maailmanlaajuisesti tunnustetun monitieteisen tapahtuman tutkijoille ja yhteiskunnallisille muutoksentekijöille sekä julkisella että yksityisellä sektorilla. Tehtävänäsi on koordinoida tätä kehitystyötä ja hallinnoida tapahtumaa Aalto-yliopistossa ja Helsingin yliopistossa relevanttien tiimien kanssa. Seuraava SSD-tapahtuma järjestetään yhdessä maailman suurimman kestävyystieteiden- ja kestävyysinnovaatioiden konferenssin SRI:n kanssa. Lue lisää täältä.Tämä on määräaikainen ja kokoaikainen tehtävä joulukuun 2025 loppuun asti.Roolisi ja tavoitteesiProjektin ja budjetin hallintaVuosittaisen tapahtuman koordinointi: kokonaisuuden ja alatyöryhmien koordinointi, viestintä, verkostoituminen, kumppanuudet ja tapahtumakalenterin hallinta, markkinointiUusien kumppanuuksien ja rahoituksen hankkiminen, sekä yksityinen että julkinenYksityisen sektorin kumppani- ja sponsoriverkostojen kehittäminen yhdessä molempien yliopistojen relevanttien tiimien kanssaVerkostosi ja tiimisiOlet osa Aalto-yliopiston Kestävän kehityksen ratkaisut -tiimiä ja Helsingin yliopiston tiimiä. Työaikasi jakaantuu HY:n ja Aallon välillä. Saat myös tukea tapahtumien hallinnan, kumppanuuden ja viestinnän tiimeiltä molemmissa yliopistoissa.Kokemuksesi ja tavoitteesiMitä odotamme sinulta?Maisterin tutkintoa tai vastaava korkeakoulututkintoaSujuvaa englannin kielen taitoaAikaisempaa kokemusta useiden sidosryhmien välisten projektien hallinnasta ja kansainvälisistä tapahtumistaToivomme sinulla olevanMonipuolista konferenssien ja tapahtumien järjestämiskokemustaKokemusta erilaisten asiantuntijaryhmien kanssa työskentelystäErinomaiset yhteistyötaidot ja kyky innostaa ja rohkaista muitaInnostus verkostoitumiseen ja viestintäänLuovuutta ja uteliaisuutta kehittää uusia työtapojaIntohimoa kestävän tulevaisuuden rakentamiseenTyökokemus ja osaaminen kestävyysasioista katsotaan eduksi.Mitä tarjoammeMerkityksellisen ja inspiroivan työympäristön. Innostavan monitieteisen työyhteisön ja ratkaisukeskeisen työkulttuurin. Kaikkea työtämme ohjaa kahden yliopiston arvot: tiede, vastuullisuus, inklusiivisuus, rohkeus, vapaus, yhteistyö ja hyvinvointi.Vastuullisen ja merkityksellisen roolin, joka mahdollistaa ainutlaatuisen yhteistyön kahden johtavan suomalaisen yliopiston välillä sekä vaikutuksen aikaansaamisessa yhteiskunnallisessa kestävyysmuutoksessa.Itsenäisen roolin ja tukevan työyhteisön.Mahdollisuudet osaamisen kehittämiseen ja oppimiseen. Tarjoamme laajan valikoiman ammatillisia kehittymismahdollisuuksia, joiden avulla voit osallistua henkilöstökoulutuksiin kiinnostuksesi ja tarpeidesi mukaan. Arvostamme työ-elämä-tasapainoa ja hyvinvointia kaikilla elämänalueilla.Kiinostuitko?Jos innostuit tehtävästä ja haluat liittyä joukkomme, lähetä seuraavat dokumentit rekrytointisivustomme kautta:Motivaatiokirje: Kuvaile, miksi olisit ihanteellinen kandidaatti tähän tehtävään. Ole mahdollisimman konkreettinen – esimerkiksi kerro viimeaikaisista saavutuksistasi ja siitä, miten kuvittelet kehittäväsi Sustainability Science Days -tapahtumaa.AnsioluetteloJos olet Aalto-yliopiston työntekijä, hae sisäisen Workday-järjestelmämme kautta > Sisäiset työpaikat.Jos haluat lisätietoa tehtävästä, voit ottaa yhteyttä:Kestävien ratkaisujen johtaja, Aalto-yliopisto: Jussi Impiö Jussi.m.impio@aalto.fiAsiantuntija, kestävyys ja vastuu, Helsingin yliopisto: Riina Koivuranta, riina.koivuranta@helsinki.fiKäymme läpi hakemuksia ja saatamme kutsua sopivia kandidaatteja haastatteluun jo hakuaikana. Tavoitteenamme on avoin ja tasapuolinen rekrytointiprosessi, joten voit rohkeasti pyytää palautetta meiltä. Hakuaika päättyy 10.11.2023.More about Aalto University:Aalto.fitwitter.com/aaltouniversityfacebook.com/aaltouniversityinstagram.com/aaltouniversity

Eat, Sleep, Scale, Repeat. And SALT is looking to scale. We are seeking a partner in crime. Do you have what it takes?SALT is a young business, so you'll get a chance to see all the ups and downs of fast-paced startup life!We have a lovely office in the heart of Vilnius where you will meet different people throughout the day and take your first steps to become a real B2B sales rock star.Someone who has a passion for B2B Sales or is pursuing a degree in International Business would be an ideal contender for this role. As an SDR, you will get to be creative with your communication approach. No big brother looking over your shoulder and assigning tasks. You will be in full control of your schedule.Rules are simple, performance = money.Your workflow looks like this:Run, monitor, and constantly improve your outreach sequences.Update and clean your CRM.Build relationships and manage massive client pipelines for our network.Communicate via emails, phone, SoMe, and all other relevant channels.Book meetings and get paid. Requirements:Being hungry to learn B2B business is more valuable than prior experience to us. Fluent in English (verbal and written).CRM experience.A performance-focused person who does not require constant babysitting and can take care of business.Being proactive and open-minded in communication, building relationships with solid empathy to understand what drives potential clients.Located in Europe and comfortable with visiting the office if necessary. What do we offer:Possibility to have a flexible work schedule and work-life balance.Remote startup work environment with the possibility to join the office team.Supportive and professional team enabling your growth aspiration. Opportunity to work for our stakeholders on different projects.Efficient onboarding with access to our knowledge base, top-flight material, best practices in the market, and workshops for your professional development.This is a Freelance / Contractor position with a starting salary of 900/month + a competitive bonus system. The sky is not the limit here for you!For more information, please get in touch with Matas Povilauskas, CEO @ SALT, on LinkedIn. We encourage you to send your application as soon as possible as we are always hiring!Join the players club!

OverviewGeosyntec is an internationally recognized company for its technical leadership, extensive experience, and exceptional level of customer service. Our ambition is to help our clients succeed by providing solutions that add value to their environmental, natural resource and infrastructure businesses. We have more than 2,100 highly qualified consultants in more than 90 offices around the world.At Geosyntec, we highly value the hiring of people who are recognised as experts in their fields, who are innovative and eager to grow. We continue to grow in Europe with numerous new hires and are now looking for environmental professionals with experience in our sector to join a newly establishing team in Finland, with environmental, mining and geotechnical practices.Specifically, we are looking for environmental specialists with experience in the preparation of environmental permitting and assessment projects and mine closure in the context of Finnish mining legislation. Our new colleague will also have the opportunity to work with a multidisciplinary network of experts in our offices in Europe, North America and Australia.Within Geosyntec's European operations, we work for both private and public clients. Examples of our projects include obtaining environmental permits, soil quality studies, risk assessments and remediation investigations of contaminated sites, environmental strategy consulting, including EIAs and environmental audits, sustainable development and technical services (from exploration to remediation) related to mining and industry.If you want more information about the company and the rest of the job offers that we advertise, please visit our website: www.geosyntec.com Education and Licensure Together with your colleagues, you will contribute to the construction of our mining business in the Nordic Region, Europe, North America, and Australia. Your role will be to interact with clients, write tenders, direct responsibility for the assigned project from start to finish and ensure that they are always carried out with adequate quality. You will lead the project team, develop junior practitioners, and play an important role as an expert and main advisor to our clients.We would like you to have experience in the preparation of permitting processing reports, environmental impact assessments, in conducting risk analysis, in the development of mine closure projects and in the preparation of tenders or detailed design documents of works, in the dimensioning and design of geostructures and in supporting contractors. If you have experience in ESG (Environmental, Social and Governance) type audits, for example in industry or mining, it will be considered an advantage.Depending on your experience, training and ambition, you will naturally have great opportunities to shape the role that best suits you and challenges you as an individual, but also develops us as a team and as a company. You will work on a wide variety of projects for our clients, both in the private and public sectors, together with a group of colleagues with 10 to 30 years of experience in the environmental field, both nationally and internationally.Collaboration and mentorship at national and international levels are the foundations of our corporate culture; you will be able to work closely with experienced consultants in our field internationally who will support you in the development of your career and in the construction of your professional networks within the Geosyntec Group.Skills, Experience And QualificationsWe would like you to have the following training, knowledge and experience: We are looking for a professional with an academic qualification in environmental science, geology or biology or equivalent engineering and several years of experience working as an environmental specialist. You will likely have a master's degree in engineering and/or environmental science from a technical university, or equivalent qualifications.  Your experience will allow you to know well the infrastructures and the construction process, from feasibility studies and research to the preparation of working documents.  Experience in hydrogeology and/or geochemistry will be considered an additional merit for the position.  We would also like you to be interested in the sustainable development challenges facing the mining industry.  The position requires the ability to collaborate and communicate both internally and externally so bilingual proficiency in Finnish and English will be valued.  Culture/EEO Statement  At Geosyntec, we are dedicated to fostering an inclusive, equitable and diverse environment for all our employees, clients, partners, and the communities that we serve.  We strive to promote a culture where every employee can bring their whole self to work, where mutual respect and understanding is the cornerstone of our values. We believe that an inclusive workplace enhances our performance and leads to positive outcomes.  Geosyntec strives to hire and retain the best and brightest people in their fields. We look for exceptional interpersonal skills, communication skills, and problem-solving abilities, plus the passion for technical excellence and quality. We seek individuals with leadership potential, a commitment to lifelong learning and growth, and the desire to build a long and rewarding career with a growing firm.  Geosyntec is a great place to build a career. If you're looking for an exciting place to work, a place with challenging and rewarding projects, and a place that has been nationally recognized for its employees' quality of life, technical expertise, and business success, then Geosyntec may be the place for you. You can learn more about careers and employment at Geosyntec by visiting geosyntec.com/careers .  Geosyntec offers excellent compensation packages commensurate with experience, along with a comprehensive employee benefits package.

job-title: SAP Sourcing & Procurement consultant to Accenture’s Nordic SAP Business Group
description: SAP Sourcing & Procurement consultant to Accenture’s Nordic SAP Business GroupDo you have a passion for transforming businesses with the newest technologies and making them data-driven companies? Are you looking for a place where you could combine your business consulting skills with technology strategy know-how? Then our roles as SAP Sourcing & Procurement consultant in our SAP Business Group are a perfect find for you!Bring your talent and passion to Accenture and help us deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity. Take this opportunity to develop your skills and build an extraordinary career. You will play a key role in transforming organizations and communities around the world. Let there be change!About Our Nordic SAP Business GroupAccenture and SAP have a longstanding relationship that extends more than 40 years. As the leading Nordic SAP transformation partner, we work with SAP end-to-end from product innovation to development and delivery. Together, we are revolutionizing the future of business through major SAP transformation programs with some of the biggest companies.Within our Nordic SAP community, we work with the newest SAP solutions and offerings such as SAP S/4 HANA Cloud, SAP CX, Ariba, SuccessFactors, SAP BTP and SAP RISE.We are now looking to expand our community at scale and are looking at candidates for several positions and seniority levels.To read more about our SAP Practice, visit us at https://www.accenture.com/us-en/services/sap-indexWhat’s in it for you:Work with some of the biggest SAP clients in large global implementation projects.Be an integral part of innovative SAP transformation projects.Significant development opportunities and support for progressing in your professional career.Rich opportunities to develop your business acumen, consulting toolbox, technical and professional skills.Access to comprehensive tools and frameworks supported by our global organization, including implementation methodologies, knowledge databases, industry leading add-on software, expert network and benchmarks.A dedicated mentor to guide you during your work with continuous feedback.Being part of our culture and core values in a truly human work environment.Utilize your functional and technical expertise in SAP Ariba and other, by analyzing, designing, and implementing business processes supported by SAP best practice solutions.Utilize your Industry expertise in the field of SAP solutions to deliver client value as a professional individual and as part of a team.Take part in our highly engaged and diverse global network, for collaboration and delivery.Competitive compensation and benefits.Help clients’ sustainability agenda through SAP transformations.Be a valuable member of our Nordic SAP Smart Procurement Value Tower and contribute to thought leadership, competence development, and sales initiatives.SAP Smart Procurement Nordic Value TowerThe sourcing & procurement function is shifting. Traditionally driven and managed by deep and complex processes, their future must become digital, data driven and automated. Helping our clients to succeed in this transformation journey is what we thrive for.SAP Smart Procurement Value Tower is one out of 10 different process specialization communities within our Nordic SAP Business Group.We work hand in hand with our procurement strategy colleagues and our global delivery centers.Our cross-Nordics team designs and configure sourcing & procurement processes in S/4 HANA, Ariba upstream and downstream processes and Fieldglass - and we excel both in large, global S/4 HANA engagements (from smart brownfield through full business transformations) as well as in more focused multi-step process capability deployments.Required QualificationsMin. 2+ years of hands-on SAP experience in an onshore project role (preferably in the Nordics)Hands on source-to-pay experience from at least two S/4HANA source-to-pay or Ariba implementation projects – ideally having worked with both.Good understanding of sourcing and procurement processes and their business value driversEagerness to shape and work in a team-oriented environmentMotivated, persistent, eager to optimize, drive for excellencePassionate about SAP, innovation and delivery of the latest technologies to your clientsEffectively work with cross-functional teams/stakeholders in an international and fast-moving environmentStrong analytical skills, result-oriented paired with highly structured working style and good sense of responsibility, flexibility, and team playerExcellent communication (verbal and written) and presentation skills to address technical and non-technical audiences in EnglishStrong will to pursue a problem, identify the source, and propose possible solutions in collaboration with other team members in a timely mannerA Bachelor or Master’s degree We recruit at different levels. For manager level and above, we would like you to see having at least 7 years of relevant project experience as well as having led a team, and ideally also some earlier involvement in the acquisition of new projects.Preferred QualificationsExperience in implementing one of the newer SAP sourcing and procurement offerings such as e.g. S/4 HANA Central Procurement, Product Sourcing (Automotive) SAP Business Network / Ariba SCC or FieldglassExperience of the full lifecycle including estimating, planning, and delivering a solution end-to-endAn SAP certification in relevant areaDeep business & industry experience in one or more industriesNordic (Danish, Norwegian, Swedish or Finnish) language spokenLocationHelsinki,FinlandEqual is greater than - Accenture welcomes and encourages applications from a diverse group of backgrounds related to gender, age, ethnicity, culture, race, religion and belief, disability, nationality, sexual orientation, and gender identity. Inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and core values, providing an environment where everyone brings distinct experience, talent and culture to their work. We invite you to be part of this diversity!

OverviewGeosyntec is an internationally recognized company for its technical leadership, extensive experience, and exceptional level of customer service. Our ambition is to help our customers succeed by providing solutions that add value to their environmental, natural resource and infrastructure business. Geosyntec was founded in 1983 and is owned by its employees. We have more than 2,100 highly qualified consultants in our more than 90 offices around the world.At Geosyntec, we highly value hiring people recognized as experts in their fields, innovative and eager to grow. We continue to grow in Europe with numerous new hires and are now looking for a Geotechnical Engineer with experience in any of the life cycles of a mining waste facility (TMF) to join our growing operation in the Nordic region. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to work with a multidisciplinary network of experts in our offices in Europe, North America and Australia.Within Geosyntec's European operations, we work for both private and public clients. Examples of our projects include obtaining environmental permits, soil quality studies, risk assessments and remediation investigations of contaminated sites, environmental strategy consultancy including EIAs and environmental audits, sustainable development and technical services (from exploration to remediation) related to mining.If you want more information about the company and the rest of the job offers we advertise, visit our website: www.geosyntec.com .Your success is our success. We encourage our professionals to continually develop their interests and skills. Advancement is based on an individual’s own performance and initiative.Essential Duties And ResponsibilitiesTogether with your colleagues, you will contribute to the construction of our mining business in the Nordic region and across Europe. Your role will focus on the development and review of TMF projects and related tasks, mainly for clients in the mining and industrial sectors, drafting tenders, managing applications from the beginning to the end of any work or project and ensuring that the client is always delivered adequate quality. You will work with different specialists, such as geotechnical engineers, mining engineers, tailing engineers or geologists, and manage and develop assigned junior staff. Experience handling commonly used design software, such as Civil 3D, CAD, Leapfrog, and Muck 3D, will be considered an advantage.Depending on your experience, training and ambition, you will naturally have great opportunities to shape the role that best suits you and challenges you as an individual, but also develops us as a team and as a company. You will work on a wide variety of projects for our clients, both in the private and public sectors, together with a group of colleagues with 10 to 30 years of experience in the environmental field, both nationally and internationally.Collaboration and mentoring at national and international levels are the foundations of our business culture; you will be able to work closely with experienced consultants in our field at an international level who will support you in the development of your career and in the construction of your professional networks within the Geosyntec Group.Skills, Experience And QualificationsWe would like you to have the following training, knowledge and experience: We are looking for candidates with a master's degree in engineering ideally with experience working as a tailings or mining waste engineer. You likely have a master's degree in civil, mining, or geotechnical engineering from a technical university or equivalent qualifications. Your experience will have provided you with a good knowledge of mining infrastructures and the construction process, from feasibility studies and research to the preparation of working documents associated with a mining operation. You will need to have experience in independently leading and initiating new field assignments.  Experience in soil mechanics, slope stability analysis, numerical modeling and/or hydrogeology, and water balances will be considered additional merit for this position. We would also like you to be interested in the sustainable development challenges facing the mining industry.  The position requires the ability to collaborate and communicate both internally and externally so bilingual proficiency in Swedish or Finnish and English will be valued.  Culture/EEO Statement  At Geosyntec, we are dedicated to fostering an inclusive, equitable and diverse environment for all our employees, clients, partners, and the communities that we serve.  We strive to promote a culture where every employee can bring their whole self to work, where mutual respect and understanding is the cornerstone of our values. We believe that an inclusive workplace enhances our performance and leads to positive outcomes.  Geosyntec strives to hire and retain the best and brightest people in their fields. We look for exceptional interpersonal skills, communication skills, and problem-solving abilities, plus the passion for technical excellence and quality. We seek individuals with leadership potential, a commitment to lifelong learning and growth, and the desire to build a long and rewarding career with a growing firm.  Geosyntec is a great place to build a career. If you're looking for an exciting place to work, a place with challenging and rewarding projects, and a place that has been nationally recognized for its employees' quality of life, technical expertise, and business success, then Geosyntec may be the place for you. You can learn more about careers and employment at Geosyntec by visiting geosyntec.com/careers.  Geosyntec offers excellent compensation packages commensurate with experience, along with a comprehensive employee benefits package.
